content: You are about to delete this file.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a confirmation message displayed when deleting a file. It prompts the user to confirm the deletion and explains that the file will be permanently deleted. This message appears in a dialog when a user attempts to delete a file.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Դուք պատրաստվում եք ջնջել այս ֆայլը:' is a literal translation, but 'file' is often translated as 'գրաբառ' (grabar) or sometimes transliterated as 'ֆայլ' (fayl) depending on the context. While 'ֆայլը' isn't technically *wrong*, 'գրաբառը' might sound more natural in a system message.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'Դուք պատրաստվում եք ջնջել այս գրաբառը:' or 'Դուք պատրաստվում եք ջնջել այս ֆայլը:' - the latter being acceptable, the former potentially sounding slightly more natural.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'このファイルを削除しようとしています。' (Kono fairu o sakujo shiyou to shiteimasu.) is a bit too verbose and formal for a simple confirmation message like 'You are about to delete this file.'. It translates to 'You are trying to delete this file.' which implies an ongoing action instead of a confirmation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: よりシンプルな表現にする: 'このファイルを削除しますか？' (Kono fairu o sakujo shimasu ka?) - 'Will you delete this file?' or 'ファイルを削除します。' (Fairu o sakujo shimasu.) - 'Deleting the file.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation '이 파일을 삭제하려고 합니다. ' (I 파일을 삭제하려고 합니다.) is a bit formal and doesn't perfectly convey the directness of 'You are about to delete this file.'. A more natural phrasing would be closer to '이 파일을 삭제할 예정입니다.' or '이 파일을 삭제합니다.'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 이 파일을 삭제할 예정입니다. (I 파일을 삭제할 예정입니다.) or 이 파일을 삭제합니다. (I 파일을 삭제합니다.)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Zamierzasz usunąć ten plik.' while grammatically correct, is a bit formal for a user-facing message. A more conversational and user-friendly option would be better.

The translation 'Este está prestes a apagar este ficheiro.' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'You are about to delete this file.'  'Este está' is grammatically incorrect and doesn't convey the intended meaning. 'Apagar' is a valid verb for delete, but the phrasing feels awkward.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Você está prestes a excluir este ficheiro.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Este está prestes' contains a grammatical error. 'Este' should be conjugated to match the subject or omitted for more natural phrasing.
The translation includes repetition of the word 'este'. While technically correct, it's stylistically less elegant.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to avoid repetition, for instance: 'Você está prestes a excluir o ficheiro.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ඔබ මෙම ගොනුව මැකීමට සැරසෙමින් සිටියි.' translates to 'You are about to attempt to delete this file.' It implies an attempt rather than a confirmation that the deletion is happening. A more accurate translation would be closer to 'You are deleting this file.'

The sentence structure is slightly awkward. While grammatically correct, it sounds less natural in Slovenian. 'Boste' is a future tense auxiliary verb, and 'Izbrisati' (to delete) would flow better directly before the object 'to datoteko'.

The translation 'Спремате се да обришете ову датотеку' is a literal translation that sounds unnatural in Serbian. 'Обришете' implies a more permanent deletion, while 'delete' can sometimes refer to temporary removal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Спремате се да избришете ову датотеку.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Spremate se da obrišete ovu datoteku' is not an accurate translation of 'You are about to delete this file.' It literally translates to 'Prepare yourself to delete this file.' A more accurate translation would convey the action is happening.
While 'datoteku' is a valid word, 'datoteu' might be more common and flow better. This is a minor stylistic point.
